intro: Strobocalyx mastersii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces its flowers in a unique structure called a calyx, which gives it its scientific name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight. Strobocalyx mastersii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
